data.text: And if a soul sin, and hear the voice of swearing, and
Or if a soul touch any unclean thing, whether
Or if he touch the uncleanness of man, whatsoever uncleanness

And it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these
And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the
And if he be not able to bring a lamb, then he shall bring for his trespass, which he hath committed, two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, unto the
And he shall bring them unto the priest, who shall offer
And he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin offering upon the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be wrung out at the bottom of the altar: it
And he shall offer the second

¶ But if he be not able to bring two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then he that sinned shall bring for his offering the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering; he shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put
Then shall he bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it,
And the priest shall make an atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and
¶ And the
If a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the

And he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.
¶ And if a soul sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the

And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred and wist
